title: Remove hardcoded secrets and use environment variables
description: Security: Hardcoded secrets in source code must be removed. (1) server/proxy.js line 28: YOUTRACK_TOKEN hardcoded—use process.env.YOUTRACK_TOKEN. (2) src/services/youtrack.ts line 79: Remove fallback YouTrack token from client bundle—use VITE_YOUTRACK_TOKEN only or ensure proxy is always used. (3) server/production-server.js and server/proxy.js: METABASE_API_KEY hardcoded—use process.env.METABASE_API_KEY. All secrets must come from env vars only.

title: Investigate and fix large chunk size warning (index.js ~1.2MB)
description: Vite build warns: main chunk (index-Dtjx9hvD.js) is 1,203.64 kB, exceeding 500 kB limit. Consider: dynamic import() for code-splitting, build.rollupOptions.output.manualChunks, or adjust build.chunkSizeWarningLimit. Investigate and implement improvements.

title: Make chart bars clickable - link to YouTrack report with matching filters
description:
When a user clicks any bar in the Projects by Priority or Projects by Status charts, navigate to a YouTrack report filtered by the matching parameters. Examples: 'To Do' bar → YouTrack issues with Type:Project State:To Do; 'High' bar → Type:Project Priority:High. Build YouTrack query URLs that pre-populate the appropriate filters.

Example URLs for ATOP projects:
- Type:Project + Priority:Low (3 - Low): https://realbrokerage.youtrack.cloud/projects/ATOP/issues?q=type:%20Project%20priority:%20%7B3%20-%20Low%7D
- Type:Project + State:Discovery: https://realbrokerage.youtrack.cloud/projects/ATOP/issues?q=type:%20Project%20state:%20Discovery

title: Projects by Status chart: Discovery projects not displaying as a bar
description: In the Projects by Status chart, projects with state 'Discovery' are not showing as a bar. The Discovery status is missing from the chart display.

title: Smoother interaction transitions
description: From UI QA Report: Buttons have good hover states, but mobile sidebar transitions could be smoother with better easing.

title: Design system and theme consistency
description: From UI QA Report: (1) Move hardcoded chart colors from index.tsx useMemo to central theme (e.g. src/config/chart-theme.ts). (2) Replace global.css body bg-slate-100 with breeze-50/breeze-100 from design system. (3) Unify design system variables—replace default Tailwind colors (slate, blue, green) with custom ocean, breeze, accent scales. (4) Remove hardcoded hex values from page components.
close_reason: Successfully unified design system variables, centralized chart colors, and updated all components to use custom theme scales (ocean, breeze, accent, priority, status).

title: Completed projects on home page shows 0 - include Archive state with Done
description: Completed projects count on the home page shows 0. The true count requires including both 'Archive' and 'Done' states when filtering for completed projects. Currently only 'Done' is considered.

title: Consolidate duplicate proxy and production-server logic
description: YouTrack proxy, Metabase inspect, and metrics endpoints duplicated between server/proxy.js and server/production-server.js. Extract shared logic into reusable modules to reduce maintenance burden and drift.

title: Projects page: In Progress count shows 19 but list displays only 12
description: On the projects page, the In Progress projects count displays 19 but the list below only shows 12 projects. Count and list are out of sync—likely a pagination limit, filter mismatch, or different data sources.

title: Replace TypeScript any with proper types
description: Codebase guidelines prohibit 'any'. Replace in: youtrack.ts (payload, result.data casts, transformIssueToTicket return), tools.tsx (inspectorResult, reportData, project casts), request.tsx (item, response.data), testYouTrack.ts (task.tags, window). Add proper interfaces.

title: New Request form: Remove New Tool and Research from dropdown
description: Remove 'New Tool' and 'Research' options from the dropdown menu in the New Request form.

title: Adjust logo size in Sidebar, Layout, and Header
description: The logo (Ao.png) is displayed in Sidebar (h-10), Layout mobile header (h-8), and Header (h-8). Adjust sizing as needed for better visual balance across breakpoints.

title: Sidebar typography contrast for accessibility
description: From UI QA Report: Ensure text-white/70 in sidebar has sufficient contrast against bg-slate-900. Consider increasing to text-white/80 or text-white/90 for inactive states.

title: Clean up src.automation_executions data - consolidate Execution Status Distribution
description: The Execution Status Distribution chart on the metrics page shows too many event/status types from src.automation_executions. Clean up or consolidate the status values in the Postgres table (via migration or data fix) so the chart displays a manageable set of status categories. May require: normalizing status values, mapping legacy values to standard ones, or archiving obsolete statuses.

title: New Request form: Add project URL field when selecting existing automation
description: When user selects 'existing automation' in the New Request form, show a new required field for the project URL from their previous request. Expected behavior: when the issue is linked, the new request is created as a Task (not a Project) and as a subtask of the input URL/project.

title: Projects page: Split filters and sort options into separate button
description: On the projects page, separate the filters and sort options into their own dedicated button(s) instead of the current combined UI. Improve discoverability and UX for filtering/sorting project lists.

title: Investigate React Router v7 future flag warnings
description: Console warnings: (1) React Router will wrap state updates in React.startTransition in v7 - use v7_startTransition future flag to opt-in early. (2) Relative route resolution within Splat routes changing in v7 - use v7_relativeSplatPath future flag. Investigate and apply future flags or plan upgrade path. See https://reactrouter.com/v6/upgrading/future

title: Evaluate and migrate frontend from Gatsby to Vite + React
description: Current build uses Gatsby but all data is fetched at runtime—Gatsby's static/GraphQL benefits are unused. Migrate to Vite + React for simpler builds, faster dev experience, and better fit for this dashboard app. Also fix pathPrefix for Render deployment (use GATSBY_PATH_PREFIX=/ for root).

title: Max fetch for YouTrack project issues capped at 100
description: The max fetch limit for YouTrack project issues appears to be hardcoded or capped at 100, but this is not the correct value. Need to investigate and fix the limit.

title: Header and navigation consolidation
description: From UI QA Report: (1) Mobile header uses solid bg-ocean-600—apply glassmorphism (backdrop-blur, transparency) to match sidebar. (2) Layout.tsx and Header.tsx have overlapping nav logic—refactor into unified Shell component with shared logic across breakpoints. (3) Apply glass-card/nav-glass styling to mobile header for visual continuity.

title: Improve chart styling - Projects by Priority and Projects by Status
description: Charts (Projects by Priority, Projects by Status) look immature. Current: soft pastel palette, rounded bar tops, subtle gradients, flat/minimalist style. Improve with: more refined color palette, cleaner typography, better visual hierarchy, professional styling (e.g. sharper edges or subtler rounding, improved axis/grid treatment, consistent design system alignment).
close_reason: Updated chart styling to use a professional, unified Ocean monochromatic theme for both Priority and Status charts. Removed tooltips and added value labels on top of bars. Updated Projects In Progress to match the new color scheme.

title: Reduce or remove console.log in production
description: Excessive console.log in youtrack.ts, request.tsx, proxy.js, production-server.js logs URLs, request bodies, response data—can leak sensitive info and add noise. Implement proper logging levels or remove debug logs for production.

title: Address TEMPORARY getDoneAutomationTasksCount
description: youtrack.ts getDoneAutomationTasksCount() has TEMPORARY comment. Either formalize as a proper feature or remove if no longer needed.
